intro: Erysimum micranthum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm. The plant features bright yellow flowers with four petals, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, often covered in fine hairs. Erysimum micranthum thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
